intro: Hemisphaera alpigena, commonly known as the alpine hemisphaera, is a perennial herb native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its distinctive hemispherical inflorescence, which gives it its common name. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Hemisphaera alpigena is often found in mountainous areas of the Alps and Pyrenees, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
